member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope
member.summary: The Scoped part of the protocol
member.remarks: Members are included in the event but often modified as part of a scope manipulation which could affect multiple outgoing events.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.ScopeOptions
member.summary: An optional scope option
member.remarks: Options are not mandatory. it allows defining callback for deciding on adding breadcrumbs and the max breadcrumbs allowed
member.returns: The options or null, if no options were defined.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Level
member.summary: Sentry level

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Transaction
member.summary: The name of the transaction in which there was an event.
member.remarks: A transaction should only be defined when it can be well defined On a Web framework, for example, a transaction is the route template rather than the actual request path. That is so GET /user/10 and /user/20 (which have route template /user/{id}) are identified as the same transaction.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Request
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Contexts
member.summary: Gets the structured Sentry context

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.User
member.summary: Gets the user information

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Environment
member.summary: The environment name, such as 'production' or 'staging'.
member.remarks: Requires Sentry 8.0 or higher

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Sdk
member.summary: SDK information
member.remarks: New in Sentry version: 8.4

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Fingerprint
member.summary: A list of strings used to dictate the deduplication of this event.
member.remarks: A value of {{ default }} will be replaced with the built-in behavior, thus allowing you to extend it, or completely replace it. New in version Protocol: version '7'

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Breadcrumbs
member.summary: A trail of events which happened prior to an issue.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Extra
member.summary: An arbitrary mapping of additional metadata to store with the event.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.Tags
member.summary: Arbitrary key-value for this event

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope.#ctor(Sentry.Protocol.IScopeOptions)
member.summary: Creates a scope with the specified options

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb
member.summary: Series of application events

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.SerializableTimestamp
member.summary: A timestamp representing when the breadcrumb occurred.
member.remarks: This can be either an ISO datetime string, or a Unix timestamp.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.Message
member.summary: If a message is provided, it’s rendered as text and the whitespace is preserved. Very long text might be abbreviated in the UI.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.Type
member.summary: The type of breadcrumb.
member.remarks: The default type is default which indicates no specific handling. Other types are currently http for HTTP requests and navigation for navigation events.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.Data
member.summary: Data associated with this breadcrumb.
member.remarks: Contains a sub-object whose contents depend on the breadcrumb type. Additional parameters that are unsupported by the type are rendered as a key/value table.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.Category
member.summary: Dotted strings that indicate what the crumb is or where it comes from.
member.remarks: Typically it’s a module name or a descriptive string. For instance aspnet.mvc.filter could be used to indicate that it came from an Action Filter.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.Level
member.summary: The level of the event.
member.remarks: Levels are used in the UI to emphasize and deemphasize the crumb.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Breadcrumb.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel
member.summary: The level of the Breadcrumb

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel.Debug
member.summary: Debug level

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel.Info
member.summary: Information level
member.remarks: This is value 0, hence, default

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel.Warning
member.summary: Warning breadcrumb level

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel.Error
member.summary: Error breadcrumb level

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.BreadcrumbLevel.Critical
member.summary: Critical breadcrumb level

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.Constants.Platform
member.summary: Platform key that defines an events is coming from any .NET implementation

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.App
member.summary: Describes the application.
member.remarks: As opposed to the runtime, this is the actual application that was running and carries meta data about the current session.

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.App.Type
member.summary: Tells Sentry which type of context this is.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.Identifier
member.summary: Version-independent application identifier, often a dotted bundle ID.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.StartTime
member.summary: Formatted UTC timestamp when the application was started by the user.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.Hash
member.summary: Application specific device identifier.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.BuildType
member.summary: String identifying the kind of build, e.g. testflight.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.Name
member.summary: Human readable application name, as it appears on the platform.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.Version
member.summary: Human readable application version, as it appears on the platform.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.App.Build
member.summary: Internal build identifier, as it appears on the platform.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.App.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Browser
member.summary: Carries information about the browser or user agent for web-related errors. This can either be the browser this event ocurred in, or the user agent of a web request that triggered the event.

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.Browser.Type
member.summary: Tells Sentry which type of context this is.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Browser.Name
member.summary: Display name of the browser application.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Browser.Version
member.summary: Version string of the browser.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Browser.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts
member.summary: Represents Sentry's structured Context

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.App
member.summary: Describes the application.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.Browser
member.summary: Describes the browser.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.Device
member.summary: Describes the device.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.OperatingSystem
member.summary: Defines the operating system.
member.remarks: In web contexts, this is the operating system of the browser (normally pulled from the User-Agent string).

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.Runtime
member.summary: This describes a runtime in more detail.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep clone of this context

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Contexts.CopyTo(Sentry.Protocol.Contexts)
member.summary: Copies the items of the context while cloning the known types

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Device
member.summary: Describes the device that caused the event. This is most appropriate for mobile applications.

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Type
member.summary: Tells Sentry which type of context this is.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Name
member.summary: The name of the device. This is typically a hostname.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Family
member.summary: The family of the device.
member.remarks: This is normally the common part of model names across generations.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Model
member.summary: The model name.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.ModelId
member.summary: An internal hardware revision to identify the device exactly.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Architecture
member.summary: The CPU architecture.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.BatteryLevel
member.summary: If the device has a battery an integer defining the battery level (in the range 0-100).

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Orientation
member.summary: This can be a string portrait or landscape to define the orientation of a device.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Simulator
member.summary: A boolean defining whether this device is a simulator or an actual device.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.MemorySize
member.summary: Total system memory available in bytes.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.FreeMemory
member.summary: Free system memory in bytes.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.UsableMemory
member.summary: Memory usable for the app in bytes.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.StorageSize
member.summary: Total device storage in bytes.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.FreeStorage
member.summary: Free device storage in bytes.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.ExternalStorageSize
member.summary: Total size of an attached external storage in bytes (e.g.: android SDK card).

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.ExternalFreeStorage
member.summary: Free size of an attached external storage in bytes (e.g.: android SDK card).

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.BootTime
member.summary: A formatted UTC timestamp when the system was booted.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Timezone
member.summary: The timezone of the device.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Device.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.DeviceOrientation
member.summary: Defines the orientation of a device.

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.DeviceOrientation.Portrait
member.summary: Portrait

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.DeviceOrientation.Landscape
member.summary: Landscape

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem
member.summary: Represents Sentry's context for OS
member.remarks: Defines the operating system that caused the event. In web contexts, this is the operating system of the browser (normally pulled from the User-Agent string).

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Type
member.summary: Tells Sentry which type of context this is.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Name
member.summary: The name of the operating system.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Version
member.summary: The version of the operating system.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.RawDescription
member.summary: An optional raw description that Sentry can use in an attempt to normalize OS info.
member.remarks: When the system doesn't expose a clear API for and this field can be used to provide a raw system info (e.g: uname)

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Build
member.summary: The internal build revision of the operating system.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.KernelVersion
member.summary: If known, this can be an independent kernel version string. Typically this is something like the entire output of the 'uname' tool.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Rooted
member.summary: An optional boolean that defines if the OS has been jailbroken or rooted.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.OperatingSystem.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime
member.summary: This describes a runtime in more detail.
member.remarks: Typically this context is used multiple times if multiple runtimes are involved (for instance if you have a JavaScript application running on top of JVM)

member.name: F:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.Type
member.summary: Tells Sentry which type of context this is.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.Name
member.summary: The name of the runtime.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.Version
member.summary: The version identifier of the runtime.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.RawDescription
member.summary: An optional raw description that Sentry can use in an attempt to normalize Runtime info.
member.remarks: When the system doesn't expose a clear API for and this field can be used to provide a raw system info (e.g: .NET Framework 4.7.1)

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.Build
member.summary: An optional build number

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Runtime.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism
member.summary: Sentry Exception Mechanism
member.remarks: The exception mechanism is an optional field residing in the Exception Interface. It carries additional information about the way the exception was created on the target system. This includes general exception values obtained from operating system or runtime APIs, as well as mechanism-specific values.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.Type
member.summary: Required unique identifier of this mechanism determining rendering and processing of the mechanism data
member.remarks: The type attribute is required to send any exception mechanism attribute, even if the SDK cannot determine the specific mechanism. In this case, set the type to "generic". See below for an example.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.Description
member.summary: Optional human readable description of the error mechanism and a possible hint on how to solve this error

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.HelpLink
member.summary: Optional fully qualified URL to an online help resource, possible interpolated with error parameters

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.Handled
member.summary: Optional flag indicating whether the exception has been handled by the user (e.g. via try..catch)

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.Meta
member.summary: Optional information from the operating system or runtime on the exception mechanism
member.remarks: The mechanism meta data usually carries error codes reported by the runtime or operating system, along with a platform dependent interpretation of these codes. SDKs can safely omit code names and descriptions for well known error codes, as it will be filled out by Sentry. For proprietary or vendor-specific error codes, adding these values will give additional information to the user.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Mechanism.Data
member.summary: Arbitrary extra data that might help the user understand the error thrown by this mechanism

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException
member.summary: Sentry Exception interface

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Type
member.summary: Exception Type

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Value
member.summary: The exception value

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Module
member.summary: The optional module, or package which the exception type lives in

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.ThreadId
member.summary: An optional value which refers to a thread in the threads interface.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Stacktrace
member.summary: Stack trace

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Mechanism
member.summary: An optional mechanism that created this exception.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryException.Data
member.summary: Arbitrary extra data that related to this error
member.remarks: The protocol does not yet support data at this level. For this reason this property is not serialized. The data is moved to the event level on Extra until such support is added

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame
member.summary: A frame of a stacktrace

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.FileName
member.summary: The relative file path to the call

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.Function
member.summary: The name of the function being called

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.Module
member.summary: Platform-specific module path

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.LineNumber
member.summary: The line number of the call

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.ColumnNumber
member.summary: The column number of the call

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.AbsolutePath
member.summary: The absolute path to filename

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.ContextLine
member.summary: Source code in filename at line number

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.PreContext
member.summary: A list of source code lines before context_line (in order) – usually [lineno - 5:lineno]

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.PostContext
member.summary: A list of source code lines after context_line (in order) – usually [lineno + 1:lineno + 5]

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.InApp
member.summary: Signifies whether this frame is related to the execution of the relevant code in this stacktrace.
member.example: For example, the frames that might power the framework’s web server of your app are probably not relevant, however calls to the framework’s library once you start handling code likely are.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.Vars
member.summary: A mapping of variables which were available within this frame (usually context-locals).

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.FramesOmitted
member.summary: Which frames were omitted, if any.
member.remarks: If the list of frames is large, you can explicitly tell the system that you’ve omitted a range of frames. The frames_omitted must be a single tuple two values: start and end.
member.example: If you only removed the 8th frame, the value would be (8, 9), meaning it started at the 8th frame, and went until the 9th (the number of frames omitted is end-start). The values should be based on a one-index.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.Package
member.summary: The assembly where the code resides

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.Platform
member.summary: This can override the platform for a single frame. Otherwise the platform of the event is assumed.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.ImageAddress
member.summary: Optionally an address of the debug image to reference. If this is set and a known image is defined by debug_meta then symbolication can take place.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.SymbolAddress
member.summary: An optional address that points to a symbol. We actually use the instruction address for symbolication but this can be used to calculate an instruction offset automatically.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackFrame.InstructionOffset
member.summary: The instruction offset
member.remarks: The official docs refer to it as 'The difference between instruction address and symbol address in bytes.' In .NET this means the IL Offset within the assembly

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackTrace
member.summary: Sentry Stacktrace interface
member.remarks: A stacktrace contains a list of frames, each with various bits (most optional) describing the context of that frame. Frames should be sorted from oldest to newest.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.SentryStackTrace.Frames
member.summary: The list of frames in the stack
member.remarks: The list of frames should be ordered by the oldest call first.

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.IScopeOptions
member.summary: Options used by

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.IScopeOptions.MaxBreadcrumbs
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum breadcrumbs.
member.remarks: When the number of events reach this configuration value, older breadcrumbs start dropping to make room for new ones.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.IScopeOptions.BeforeBreadcrumb
member.summary: Invoked before storing a new breadcrumb
member.remarks: Allows the callback handler access to a breadcrumb and allows modification or totally dropping the breadcrumb by returning null.

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.LogEntry
member.summary: Sentry Message interface
member.remarks: This interface enables support to structured logging.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.LogEntry.Message
member.summary: The raw message string (uninterpolated)
member.remarks: Must be no more than 1000 characters in length.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.LogEntry.Params
member.summary: The optional list of formatting parameters

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.LogEntry.Formatted
member.summary: The formatted message

member.summary: Represents a package used to compose the SDK

member.summary: The name of the package

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Package.Version
member.summary: The version of the package

member.summary: Creates a new instance of a

member.name: T:Sentry.Protocol.Request
member.summary: Sentry HTTP interface

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the full request URL, if available.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the method of the request.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Data
member.summary: Submitted data in whatever format makes most sense.
member.remarks: This data should not be provided by default as it can get quite large

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.QueryString
member.summary: Gets or sets the unparsed query string.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Cookies
member.summary: Gets or sets the cookies.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets the headers.
member.remarks: If a header appears multiple times it needs to be merged according to the HTTP standard for header merging.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Env
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional environment data.
member.remarks: This is where information such as IIS/CGI keys go that are not HTTP headers.

member.name: P:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Other
member.summary: Gets or sets some optional other data.

member.name: M:Sentry.Protocol.Request.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance
member.remarks: This is a shallow copy. References like could hold a mutable, non-thread-safe object.

member.name: M:Sentry.BaseScopeExtensions.Apply(Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope,Sentry.Protocol.BaseScope)
member.summary: Applies the data from one scope to the other while
member.param: The scope to data copy from.
The scope to copy data to.
member.remarks: Applies the data of 'from' into 'to'. If data in 'from' is null, 'to' is unmodified. Conflicting keys are not overriden This is a shallow copy.

member.summary: Applies the state object into the scope
member.param: The scope to apply the data.

member.name: T:Sentry.Dsn
member.summary: The Data Source Name of a given project in Sentry.

member.name: P:Sentry.Dsn.ProjectId
member.summary: The project ID which the authenticated user is bound to.

member.name: P:Sentry.Dsn.Path
member.summary: An optional path of which Sentry is hosted

member.name: P:Sentry.Dsn.SecretKey
member.summary: The optional secret key to authenticate the SDK.

member.name: P:Sentry.Dsn.PublicKey
member.summary: The required public key to authenticate the SDK.

member.name: P:Sentry.Dsn.SentryUri
member.summary: The URI used to communicate with Sentry

member.name: M:Sentry.Dsn.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: A legacy DSN containing a secret will also be accepted: {PROTOCOL}://{PUBLIC_KEY}:{SECRET_KEY}@{HOST}/{PATH}{PROJECT_ID}

member.name: M:Sentry.Dsn.IsDisabled(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified DSN means a disabled SDK or not..
member.returns: true if the string represents a disabled DSN; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sentry.Dsn.TryParse(System.String,Sentry.Dsn@)
member.summary: Tries to parse the string into a
member.returns: true if the string is a valid as was successfully parsed. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Sentry.Dsn.ToString
member.summary: The original DSN string used to create this instance

member.name: T:Sentry.SentryEvent
member.summary: An event to be sent to Sentry

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Exception
member.summary: The used to create this event.
member.remarks: The information from this exception is used by the Sentry SDK to add the relevant data to the event prior to sending to Sentry.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.EventId
member.summary: The unique identifier of this event
member.remarks: Hexadecimal string representing a uuid4 value. The length is exactly 32 characters (no dashes!)

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Timestamp
member.summary: Indicates when the event was created

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Message
member.summary: Gets the message that describes this event

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.LogEntry
member.summary: Gets the structured message that describes this event
member.remarks: This helps Sentry group events together as the grouping happens on the template message instead of the result string message.
member.example: LogEntry will have a template like: 'user {0} logged in' Or structured logging template '{user} has logged in'

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Logger
member.summary: Name of the logger (or source) of the event

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Platform
member.summary: The name of the platform

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Culprit
member.summary: The culprit
member.remarks: This value is essentially obsolete in favor of Transaction.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.ServerName
member.summary: Identifies the host SDK from which the event was recorded.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Release
member.summary: The release version of the application.

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Stacktrace
member.summary: Stack trace

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.SentryExceptions
member.summary: The Sentry Exception interface

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.SentryThreads
member.summary: The Sentry Thread interface

member.name: P:Sentry.SentryEvent.Modules
member.summary: A list of relevant modules and their versions.

member.name: M:Sentry.SentryEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of

member.name: M:Sentry.SentryEvent.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a Sentry event with optional Exception details and default values like Id and Timestamp
